conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, interior volume reads clearly, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with readable corners and volumes; isometric/elevated view; clean cutaway. Minor issues: some interior walls/edges appear stylized (curved/rounded transitions) versus strictly planar 2D wall geometry.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall 3BHK arrangement largely matches (central living/dining, kitchen zone to one side, three bedrooms around). However, several wall runs and passage geometry look smoothed/curved in 3D compared to the rectilinear 2D plan, and some secondary spaces (utility/balconies/toilet placements) appear approximated rather than strictly matched in size and location.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present and assigned to plausible rooms (beds in bedrooms, sofa set in living, dining table, kitchen counters, bathroom fixtures). Minor scale/orientation simplifications compared to exact plan clearances.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable walls/floors/openings with good lighting and minimal artifacts. Some openings and partitions are harder to verify precisely due to uniform white materials and stylized/rounded wall details.

detected_errors.description: Noticeable layout/wall-geometry distortion: several partitions and circulation edges appear curved/rounded or repositioned relative to the strictly rectilinear 2D plan, reducing strict wall-run fidelity.
Doors/windows and balcony/utility openings are present but not all can be confirmed on the exact same walls with matching proportions from the 2D plan.
Uniform material palette and some stylized geometry make precise verification of smaller partitions/openings less clear.

summary: A valid cutaway 3D conversion with strong spatial readability and furnishing, but with moderate deviations from the 2D plan in wall-run exactness and some secondary opening/space placements.
